title: Karnataka crisis: As DKS sends 'calibrated signals' to high command - is â€˜wordâ€™ the way forward?
content: Karnataka's leadership tussle intensifies as Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM Shivakumar head to Delhi for crucial talks. A reported 2023 power-sharing "word" between them is now at the center, with Shivakumar's camp emphasizing the need to honor commitments for party credibility. The high command faces pressure to resolve the simmering dispute.

title: Software glitch hits Airbus A320: 6,000 jets grounded worldwide; IndiGo, AI brace for disruption
content: Air travel faces significant disruption this weekend as over 350 IndiGo and Air India A320 family aircraft in India, and thousands globally, are grounded for a crucial software upgrade. This precautionary measure follows an incident where an A320 unexpectedly pitched downward, potentially due to solar radiation affecting flight control data. The upgrade aims to ensure fleet safety.

title: No â€˜goodâ€™ AQI in major cities: 10-year study flags persistent pollution; Delhi tops list
content: A decade-long study reveals no major Indian city met safe air quality standards between 2015 and November 2025. Delhi consistently ranked as the most polluted, with other cities also experiencing unhealthy AQI levels. Vehicular emissions, industrial pollution, and crop burning are identified as key contributors, exacerbated by geographical factors and weather patterns.

title: Kedarnath chopper crash: Report reveals pilot's last words - 'Cannot see anything, turning ...'
content: A pilot's final words, "Cannot see anything, turningâ€¦", preceded a fatal helicopter crash near Gaurikund en route to Kedarnath. The Aryan Aviation Bell 407, flying in unpredictable cloud banks, lost visibility and hit a hillside, killing all seven on board. The incident highlights significant weather monitoring shortcomings.

title: Modi-Putin meet on Dec 5: Defence & energy talks in focus; West watches closely
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit India next week for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit, a state visit expected to strengthen defense and trade ties. This visit, Putin's first to India since the Ukraine invasion, will be closely watched by Western nations as India navigates its strategic partnerships.

title: â€˜Staggering damageâ€™: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: SC: Will frame rules, menstrual shaming must end, period.
content: The Supreme Court is set to frame guidelines to protect women's health, dignity, and privacy concerning menstruation, prompted by an incident where sanitation workers were forced to prove they were menstruating. The court expressed concern over 'period-shaming' and issued notices to the Centre, acknowledging the SCBA's petition highlighting widespread such violations.

title: Trump claims any document signed by Biden using autopen is 'terminated'
content: In a dramatic turn of events, ex-President Donald Trump has announced the invalidation of executive orders issued by Joe Biden via autopen, alleging misuse of the device. Trump has also issued a stern warning of potential perjury accusations against Biden if he maintains that his staff acted under his orders.

title: Bihar polls: No oppn requests for EVM check or repoll, says EC; junks 'vote chori' claims
content: The allegations of vote manipulation by opposition parties in Bihar have been thoroughly dismissed by the Election Commission. They confirmed that no requests for EVM verification were logged, and the routine VVPAT audits showed alignment with the official counts.

title: Mark Carney tells Canadians - US tariffs will wipe $50 billion from Canada's economy
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is rolling back climate rules and encouraging pipeline construction to boost the energy sector amidst US tariff uncertainty. This move aims to diversify oil exports and reduce reliance on the US market, though it sparks internal government tensions and environmentalist criticism.

title: Maharashtra local polls: SC clears election process; 50% cap upheld
content: The Supreme Court has allowed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to proceed with elections for most local bodies, excluding those with over 50% reservation. Polls for 57 civic bodies exceeding this limit will be subject to the court's final decision on January 21, with results pending the outcome.

title: Harshita Brella case: UK police face misconduct proceedings; family demands answers
content: Four Northamptonshire police officers face misconduct proceedings for their handling of domestic abuse complaints made by Harshita Brella before her death. Brella reported abuse by her husband, Pankaj Lamba, who is accused of murdering her and fleeing to India. An investigation found that officers may not have adequately supported Brella, potentially contributing to the tragic outcome.

title: Fortnite Zero Hour live event start timings for all regions
content: Fortnite's "Zero Hour" live event on November 29, 2025, will be a massive, Avengers-style showdown concluding the current chapter. This one-time spectacle transitions the game into Chapter 7 Season 1, featuring potential crossovers with Godzilla, Kong, and more. Players are advised to join the event lobby early to secure their spot for this unrepeatable experience.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250bn; claims 'we lead industry'
content: Nvidia's stock plummeted by $250 billion after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering significant spending on Google's competing AI chips. This move signals a potential shift in the AI hardware market, with Google's TPUs emerging as a credible alternative to Nvidia's dominant position.

title: JEE, NEET and CUET in Class XI? Reforms to cut dependence on coaching on cards
content: A central panel is proposing significant reforms to reduce student reliance on coaching centres. Key suggestions include holding competitive exams as early as Class XI, limiting daily coaching to two-three hours, and exploring a hybrid assessment model combining board performance with aptitude tests. These measures aim to ease academic pressure and re-emphasize school-based learning.

title: Is Giannis Antetokounmpo playing tonight vs Knicks? Latest update
content: Milwaukee faces a crucial NBA Cup game against the Knicks on November 28, 2025, with Giannis Antetokounmpo's availability uncertain due to a left adductor strain.  A six-game losing streak has amplified the pressure on the Bucks, who are desperate for a win to keep their Cup aspirations alive.  Other injuries further complicate their challenge.

title: Explainer: India's GDP grows at 8.2%, fastest in 6 quarters; is there a catch?
content: Indiaâ€™s GDP has grown at a robust 8.2% in the second quarter. Why has the real GDP growth been more than expected and whatâ€™s the outlook for the coming quarters? Why are economists pointing to the narrowing gap between nominal and real GDP growth? We explore:

title: Saquon Barkley injury update: Will Eagles RB play today vs Chicago Bears?
content: Eagles fans can breathe easy as Saquon Barkley is cleared to play. His groin injury update offers positive news for the team's upcoming game. Barkley's availability is crucial for the Eagles' offense. He is expected to play and contribute significantly. The team can now proceed with their usual game plan.

title: Nick Fuentes demands proof after Candace Owens links Macron, Kirk to plot
content: Candace Owens' explosive claims on X, alleging French President Macron and his wife paid for her assassination and French Legion soldiers killed Charlie Kirk, have been met with skepticism. Right-wing commentator Nick Fuentes publicly demanded proof, calling her stories 'crazy' and lacking evidence, particularly mocking her claims about Brigitte Macron's family history and gender.

title: DJ Moore injury update: WR1 expected to play vs Philadelphia Eagles tonight
content: Bears star wide receiver DJ Moore is cleared to play. His availability is crucial for the team's offense. Moore's presence opens up the field and allows for more aggressive play-calling. He is a dependable target for the quarterback. His return is expected to bring game-changing moments for Chicago. The team will rely on him heavily.

title: Mhatre breaks Rohit's record, becomes youngest ever to reach this feat
content: Mumbai's Ayush Mhatre, at 18, has become the youngest cricketer to score centuries in first-class, List A, and T20 formats. He achieved this with an unbeaten 110 off 53 balls in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, surpassing Rohit Sharma's record. This stellar performance also earned him captaincy of the India U19 squad and retention by Chennai Super Kings.

title: The White House, for sale: Inside Trumpâ€™s Black Friday presidency
content: President Trump's second term has transformed US governance into a marketplace for influence, where policy and personal enrichment are intertwined.  From foreign gifts to crypto ventures, access to power now dictates economic success.  This 'Black Friday presidency' sees reduced enforcement and new pay-to-play schemes, making Washington a transactional hub.

title: Sidda vs DKS in Karnataka: Did Cong high command fail to act on time, yet again?
content: Karnataka finds itself engulfed in a tumultuous political crisis as tensions rise between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar. This escalating feud evokes memories of previous leadership battles in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan, where indecisive moves from the Congress high command contributed to electoral failures.

title: How to improve blood circulation in legs naturally
content: Maintaining good leg circulation is vital for overall vascular health, preventing issues like swelling and pain. Natural approaches include exercise, dietary adjustments, and lifestyle changes. Specific exercises, leg elevation, compression, and a diet rich in antioxidants and fiber significantly improve blood flow and vascular function.

title: Police fired on Leh protesters without orders, Congress tells probe panel
content: Leh police allegedly used excessive lethal force without magistrate orders during protests for statehood and Sixth Schedule status, resulting in four deaths and over 80 injuries. Congress and Anjuman-Moin-ul-Islam have submitted claims to a judicial probe commission, highlighting violations of constitutional rights and police protocols.

title: LaMelo Ball injury update: Hornets star expected to play tonight vs Bulls
content: LaMelo Ball is fully available for the Charlotte Hornets' NBA Cup game against the Chicago Bulls on November 28, 2025, bringing much-needed direction to a struggling team. The Bulls, however, are facing a severe injury crisis, potentially missing up to seven rotation players, presenting a prime opportunity for the Hornets to regain momentum.

title: Dion Dawkinsâ€™ fiancÃ©e Daiyaana Muhammad reveals unseen struggles of NFL life
content: Daiyaana Muhammad, fiancÃ©e of NFL player Dion Dawkins, shared the realities of life with an athlete.  She highlighted the unseen pressures, distance, and emotional care partners provide.  Muhammad also confirmed her engagement to Dawkins.  She finds community among other WAGs, appreciating their shared understanding and support.  Muhammad also maintains her own successful modeling career.

title: Lane Kiffinâ€™s final Ole Miss game clouded by shocking 3am locker-room incident
content: Ole Miss's locker room was reportedly broken into early Friday morning before the Egg Bowl, with quarterback Trinidad Chambliss's jersey stolen. Head coach Lane Kiffin revealed the incident, captured on cameras installed by the equipment manager, added significant stress hours before the crucial rivalry game.  This occurred amidst intense speculation about Kiffin's future with the program.

title: Rohit Sharma on brink of massive milestone in Ranchi
content: Rohit Sharma is on the cusp of a significant milestone, needing just 98 runs to surpass 20,000 international runs. He aims to join Indian legends Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli, and Rahul Dravid in this elite club during the upcoming ODI series against South Africa.

title: US-India trade pact by year-end? Top trade official shares update; adds caution
content: India aims to finalize the initial phase of its Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by year-end, with commerce secretary Rajesh Agarwal expressing optimism despite global trade shifts. Negotiations have advanced significantly, though last-minute hurdles remain a possibility. Discussions are also progressing on an immediate Framework Trade Deal to address US tariffs on Indian goods.

title: K'taka CM tussle: Cong high command cracks whip; Sidda invites DKS for breakfast meet
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has invited Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar for breakfast following a directive from the party high command to discuss the ongoing "power tussle" over the chief ministerial post. This meeting comes as the Congress government reaches its halfway mark, with reports of Shivakumar's faction pushing for a leadership transition.

title: Dana White unveils UFC 324 lineup as major title fights head to Las Vegas
content: Dana White unveiled a stacked UFC 324 card for January 24, 2026, in Las Vegas, headlined by an interim lightweight title fight between Justin Gaethje and Paddy Pimblett. The event also features Amanda Nunes' return to face Kayla Harrison for the women's bantamweight title and Sean O'Malley against Song Yadong.

title: Understanding Type 5 diabetes and how it differs from other types
content: A new form of diabetes, Type 5, linked to chronic malnutrition, is emerging globally, particularly in low-income regions. Unlike other types, it stems from impaired pancreatic development due to nutrient deficiencies, affecting younger individuals who are often underweight. Early detection and tailored management are crucial to combat its serious complications.

title: Joel Embiid out tonight: 76ers star sidelined vs Nets with knee issue
content: The Philadelphia 76ers face the Brooklyn Nets in the NBA Cup without their MVP Joel Embiid, sidelined by ongoing right knee management. This marks his ninth consecutive missed game, highlighting the team's depth challenges. With several other key players also out, the Sixers, led by Tyrese Maxey, aim for resilience against a similarly shorthanded Nets squad.

title: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma set for 2027 World Cup? Morkel turns heads
content: The three-match ODI series against South Africa begins on Sunday in Ranchi, with the remaining fixtures scheduled in Raipur on Wednesday and Visakhapatnam on Saturday. Rohit enters the series in solid touch, having scored a century and a fifty in the recent ODI series against Australia, including his 33rd ODI ton in Sydney. Kohli, after recording back-to-back ducks in the first two ODIs of that series, bounced back with an unbeaten 74 in the final match.

title: India gets 'major power' status: Op Sindoor boosts military ranking - report
content: India has achieved 'major power' status, ranking third in Asia according to the Lowy Institute's Power Index. This rise is attributed to its growing economic and military strengths, notably boosted by recent combat experience in Operation Sindoor. While India leads Japan and Russia, a significant gap remains with China and the US, the top two superpowers.

title: K'taka CM tussle: Cong veteran Moily breathes fire; blames top brass of being blind
content: Veteran Congress leader M Veerappa Moily has criticized the party's high command for the ongoing leadership crisis in Karnataka. He emphasized the need for discipline within the party, stating that leadership representatives should have anticipated the current political turmoil. Moily refrained from commenting on specific leadership changes, focusing instead on the immediate requirement for party discipline.

title: Booster shot! India's GDP grows at 8.2% in Q2; beats expectations - top highlights
content: India's economy surged past expectations, posting an impressive 8.2% real GDP growth in the second quarter of FY 2025-26, the highest in six quarters. This robust performance solidifies India's position as the world's fastest-growing major economy, driven by strong secondary and tertiary sector contributions. Private consumption also showed a healthy uptick.

title: Better digestion, weight management: What happens when you drink ajwain water everyday
content: The body's metabolic rate increases when you drink ajwain water which results in better calorie burning efficiency. The weight management properties of ajwain possesses stem from its ability to boost fat metabolism. Ajwain functions as a natural diuretic, which helps people eliminate excess water and salt from their bodies

title: â€˜Reflects pro-growth policiesâ€™: PM Modi lauds 8.2% GDP data; vows to advance reforms
content: India's economy surged by 8.2% in the July-September quarter, marking a six-quarter high. Prime Minister Modi attributed this robust growth to the "hard work and enterprise" of Indians and the government's pro-growth policies. Finance Minister Sitharaman highlighted sustained economic momentum driven by reforms and fiscal consolidation, reinforcing India's position as the world's fastest-growing major economy.

title: Trump threatens to halt migration for good: Which countries count as â€˜Third Worldâ€™?
content: In a bold move, US President Donald Trump announced his intention to completely stop immigration from 'developing nations,' highlighting issues of national security and ineffective policies. His agenda includes cracking down on illegal entries, expelling potential threats, and restricting benefits for non-citizens.

title: The growing divide: Why employees are losing connection with employers in 2026
content: Glassdoorâ€™s Worklife Trends 2026 reveals a workplace strained by declining trust, shifting power dynamics, and AI-driven upheaval. Leadership ratings have fallen sharply as workers report rising misalignment, poor communication, and eroding opportunitiesâ€”especially for remote staff. With key industries facing heightened instability, the report warns that rebuilding trust between leaders and employees will define workplace stability in 2026.

title: Sunil Grover's spot-on mimicry of Kapil Dev leaves Virat Kohli in splits of laughter
content: Comedian Sunil Grover recently entertained cricketer Virat Kohli. Grover impersonated legendary cricketer Kapil Dev. His mimicry left Kohli in splits of laughter. Videos of the event are circulating online. Grover joked about Kohli's beard in his Kapil Dev act. The host asked Grover to go easy as Kohli has upcoming matches.

title: Kiffin to make 'hard decision' on future Saturday
content: Lane Kiffin said he'll decide Saturday whether he will return as Ole Miss' coach in 2026 or take another job, presumably at LSU.

title: Giants' Dart to start MNF; 'been waiting' to play
content: After missing the past two games while in concussion protocol, rookie Jaxson Dart has reclaimed his spot as the Giants' QB1 and will return to face the Patriots on Monday night.

title: Court order: Lakers to use usual floor for Cup tilt
content: The Lakers will play Friday night's NBA Cup game against the Mavericks on their regular court following issues with the Cup-themed surface.

title: Sources: Florida shifting focus away from Kiffin
content: Florida has shifted its focus away from Lane Kiffin in the school's coaching search, as the school has sensed through irregular communication that he's interested in other options, sources told ESPN on Friday.

title: Iran boycotting World Cup draw citing visa denials
content: Iran has decided to boycott the 2026 World Cup draw in Washington next week because the U.S. denied visas to members of its delegation, the state-run IRNA news agency reported on Friday.

title: Jets' Boyd back in hospital with 'health issues'
content: Jets player Kris Boyd is back in the hospital with "health issues," he wrote in a social media post Wednesday night nearly two weeks after he was shot outside of a New York restaurant.

title: U.S. proposes 14 sites to host 2031 Women's WC
content: The United States Soccer Federation proposed 14 American sites among 20 possible venues to host games for the 2031 Women's World Cup.

content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Oil Tankers Hit By Blasts, Fire In Black Sea: Turkey
content: Turkish authorities on Friday said they had taken crews off two oil tankers in the Black Sea after explosions and fires, suggesting they may have been hit by devices.

title: IndiGo, Air India Flights To Face Major Disruption Over A320 Software Issue
content: IndiGo, Air India and Air India Express flight operations will see disruptions as they work on fixing a potential issue related to flight controls in their A320 family planes and 200-250 aircraft will be impacted in the country, according to sources.

title: Airbus Warns Of Disruption Over A320 Software Switch
content: Airbus on Friday warned of potential travel disruption as it upgrades some 6,000 operational A320 aircraft, after an incident on a JetBlue flight last month.

title: Trump Says Any Document Signed By Biden With Autopen Is "Terminated"
content: Donald Trump said Friday all documents signed by autopen under Joe Biden were "terminated," in a legally uncertain move as the US president escalates attacks on his predecessor.

title: Trump, Maduro Spoke Last Week, Discussed A Possible Meeting: Report
content: US President Donald Trump spoke with Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro last week and discussed a possible meeting between them in the United States, the New York Times reported on Friday, citing multiple people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Scientist At Defence Research Body DRDO Found Dead At Rajasthan Home
content: Just two days after his marriage, a DRDO scientist, Aditya Verma, was found dead at his home in Rajasthan's Alwar, police said.

title: Congress MLA Raped Complainant Multiple Times When She Was Pregnant: Cops
content: The police FIR against suspended Congress MLA Rahul Mamkoottathil alleged that he raped the complainant multiple times even when she was pregnant.

title: Police Stop Married Cop's Wedding With Another Woman In Rajasthan
content: A police constable in Alwar was caught on Friday allegedly marrying a second woman while still legally married to his first wife, officials said.

title: Court Rejects Mehul Choksi's Plea To Drop Fugitive Economic Offender Tag
content: In a setback to diamantaire Mehul Choksi, a prime accused in the Punjab National Bank (PNB) fraud case, a special court here on Friday rejected his application seeking to drop the proceedings declaring him a Fugitive Economic Offender.

title: "No War, No Conflict": Siddaramaiah's Son On Karnataka Chief Minister Row
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son and Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah downplays the leadership tussle between his father and Deputy Chief Minister and State Congress President DK Shivakumar.

title: Senior Congress Leader, Former Union Minister Shriprakash Jaiswal Dies At 81
content: Senior Congress leader and former Union Minister Shriprakash Jaiswal breathed his last in Kanpur on Friday evening after a prolonged illness. He was 81.

title: Cigarette Caused Hong Kong Fire? Worker Seen Smoking Moments Before Tragedy
content: At least 128 people died on Wednesday in one of Hong Kong's worst fires in decades, after flames swept through Wang Fuk Court in Tai Po, a residential complex in the city's hilly New Territories.

title: Ghazipur Police Station Opposite Landfill Makes Delhi 'Shine', Ranked India's Best
content: A police station standing opposite to Delhi's towering Ghazipur landfill -- a site known more for stench and toxic fumes -- has scripted a success story by emerging as the best police station in India at the All India Police Conference in Raipur.

title: Sourav Ganguly's Wife Files Complaint Against Social Media Abuse
content: Renowned Odissi dancer Dona Ganguly has lodged a complaint with the police after being allegedly targeted with abusive and derogatory remarks on social media, an officer said on Friday.

title: Zerodha Founder Teases Elon Musk Podcast, Breaks Internet
content: Zerodha founder Nikhil Kamath has revealed a sneak peek of his upcoming podcast episode featuring none other than Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk.

title: Imran Khan's Sister Goes To Court For Not Being Allowed To Meet Him In Jail
content: Imran Khan's sister on Friday filed a contempt of court petition in the Islamabad High Court (IHC) against the Adiala Jail superintendent and others for not being allowed to meet Pakistan's jailed former prime minister.

title: J&K Medical College's Plea For 100% All-India MBBS Quota Rejected
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) rejected a proposal from the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence seeking to place its MBBS seats under the All India Quota to be filled through the Medical Counselling Committee.

title: Marriage Reduced To Commercial Transaction Due To Evil Of Dowry: Top Court
content: Marriage is a sacred and noble institution founded on mutual trust, companionship and respect, but the pious bond has regrettably been reduced to a mere commercial transaction due to the evil of dowry, the Supreme Court remarked on Friday.

title: 13 To 15% Of Delhi's Groundwater Samples Contaminated With Uranium: Report
content: The Annual Ground Water Quality Report 2025, which was made public on Friday, has indicated that 13 to 15 per cent of the total collected water samples have uranium contamination.

content: Widening its probe into the alleged financial irregularities at the Al Falah Group and Trust, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has detected that its arrested chairman could have acquired some land parcels in Delhi by "forging" documents.

content: BJP alleges attempt to turn West Bengal into â€œWest Bangladeshâ€ as Murshidabad remarks spark controversy ahead of elections

title: Madras High Court rejects Letters Rogatory issued by district court of Delaware in the United States

title: Kerala Governor cannot sit on report on V-C postings: SC
content: State tells court that Governor failed to act on a list of names shortlisted by a former SC judge-led committee and forwarded by CM as per SC directive; SC says Governor cannot treat the report as an â€˜ordinary piece of paperâ€™

title: Train services hit by locomotive failure at Kalamassery
content: As a precautionary safety measure, train movements on the adjacent main line were temporarily suspended, and services were operated in both directions on the single line, say railway sources

title: Cabinet okays LPS II in Amaravati and â‚¹7500 crore NaBFID loan for capital infrastructure
content: The approval for LPS II in seven Amaravati villages comes with a broader push to accelerate capital region development, including major infrastructure support measures and reforms cleared by the Cabinet

title: Telangana aspires to emerge as Indiaâ€™s design capital
content: A Centre of Design Excellence to embed design in governance, business and education is proposed to be set up in Hyderabad by 2030 which will support manufacturing and service sectors through design innovation, research and development and communication design

title: ED probes cross-border smuggling network
content: The agency also detected the alleged misuse of Goods and Services Tax credentials belonging to Indians by Myanmar nationals to facilitate the purchase of raw materials.

title: SCTIMST launches space medicine centre and bioastronautics fellowship
content: It has also launched the Centre for Skills and Simulation Lab (CSSL) at its Biomedical Technology Wing, Poojappura.

title: Delhi High Court quashes Lokpal proceedings against Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh
content: The complainant alleged irregularities in promotions conducted by the NPC on March 28, 2023 on which Lokpal has issued inquiry orders

title: Leadership change: Congress high command carefully weighing multiple options
content: Congress sources said that the partyâ€™s top leadership is likely to take a cautious approach based on the factors that hold good for the party in Karnataka, a major state where the party is in power

title: Siddaramaiah, Shivakumar to break bread together on November 29

title: Rahul calls for a debate on air pollution in Parliament, says Modi govt sitting idle

title: Stanford names ex-QB Pritchard new head coach

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: the beauty of Rivalry Week is that the 13 weeks preceded it are little more than periphery details . the massive disappointment felt by Clemson and South Carolina fans is of little consequence this weekend . at least one fan base will earn some needed redemption after a lost seas .

title: Bears beat Eagles in Philly, boos rain down on Lincoln Financial
content: the Philadelphia Eagles were tied with the Broncos for the most one-score wins in the NFL . this pivotal NFC showdown ended in relatively close fashion with the Bears beating the Eagles 24-15 . the win went a long way in changing the conversation about whether the 2025 Bears are as good as their record .
